website_summaries.verdict: The Q Acoustics 3020 are a lively and engrossing set of compact speakers that offer true audiophile quality without the high price.
pros: The affordable Q Acoustics 3020s bring a dynamic and detailed performance to your favorite tunes
Construction is excellent, and there are four color options
Their compact size makes it a good fit if you don't want a bigger speaker box
cons: The Q Acoustics don't reproduce much in the way of bass, and their exciting nature means they could become tiring with the wrong material

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend a subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: There isn't a lot of bass to this speaker. However, it's adequate for nearfield listening or close to a wall. I would highly recommend a subwoofer. Though the bass isn't deep, it has decent impact, and all frequencies have a lot of detail. I have the Elac B5s as well, and these are better sounding with regards to transients and detail. The bass is the only problem, and the Elacs still need bass for some genres and movies. The build quality is superb, it comes with a nice pair of cables, and the packaging is great. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Hasan

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable for the money
customer_reviews.text: The speakers were ordered on the 9th & arrived on the 11th. They were boxed as if there were a million dollars in there. Got them out & now in my system. They are something much more than expected The build quality is 5 out 5 stars more important the sound is excellent. For got that the stereo was on & thought some one was speaking in the room. I put the port plugs in because I have a 15" sub to take the music down to 25hz and the Q's blend in very well. If you are looking for a pair of bookshelf & you want to spend 250.00 don't think twice.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound---I could not be happier with a bookshelf speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality with very clean clear sound. I have listened to piano, violin, guitar, Hammond organ, female and male opera, Alice Cooper,...you just can't beat it--nothing to complain about and I am very picky about my music. You need a good subwoofer to take care of the bottom end. You can't do better for anywhere near the price. Beautifully engineered--you would have to spend $3000 to get a better sound stage than the Q Acoustics 3020. I am very satisfied with these small speakers.
customer_reviews.author: keymanwst

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound amazing! I did a lot of research before purchasing, I wanted the best bookshelf speakers I could get for under $300. At $250, I'm not at all disappointed. I have them in my bedroom (20' X 20') they are plenty loud enough for a room that size and sound and look like much more expensive speakers. The fit and finish is great. They have 5" "bass units" so needless to say, if you like bass, you will definitely need a subwoofer. They also come with a 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: J Davis

customer_reviews.title: great tone. Some of the best sound I’ve ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Uhh. B&W 685, Elac B5, Klipsch. Tried them all. No comparison. These speakers are INCREDIBLE. Not even broken in, out of the box - so clear, great tone. Some of the best sound I’ve ever heard. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: clarity and volume in a small package
customer_reviews.text: These Q Acoustics 3020 speakers are great. They have great clarity, I hear many details I haven't heard previously. They also have great range and work fine by themselves. I paired mine with a Polk Audio PSW10 sub woofer, but they would have done fine without it. My listening area is a 12 x 15 den/office. They fill the space with no trouble. My stereo receiver is an Onkyo Tx-8020 and my CD player is Onkyo DXC390.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual listening.
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use them with my Yamaha R-S202 in bluetooth streaming mode from my PC and they pair very well. I am impressed with the soundstage and how well they fill my apartment. For more critical music listening I do prefer my KEF Q100 speakers though a different amp. I love the look of the Walnut veneer and the rounded edges. It looks awesome sitting on my TV console. The magnetic grills are a nice touch that I wish more brands would do. I think the 3020's actually pair better with the R-S202 than the KEF's do. It's hard to beat this combo for the total cost of $400.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Twain

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set, so that should say a lot. They're almost too bass heavy in my bedroom, they're wall mounted. My other speaker are Totem Model 1's, so the comparison is relevant.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Superb compact speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound from these compact speakers filling a large room. I had to incorporate one of them into a bookcase but by leaving 3inches behind and to the sides and adjusting the supplied mufflers I managed to balance the sound correctly with the other speaker that is more freely mounted. Ever so pleased with them, a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Benjym99

customer_reviews.title: Won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: These are great bookshelf speakers! The sound is magnificent if you have an amplifier. One downfall for me was the bass is weak. I purchased a 10” subwoofer as well. The addition of the sub makes the sound spectacular! Can’t miss on this buy.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! The Q Acoustics 3020 speakers are an engineering marvel. The small design belies the rich, full sound coming out of these speakers. Incredible.
customer_reviews.author: TamHam

customer_reviews.title: It could be better if there is 8 ohm version
customer_reviews.text: It could be better if there is 8 ohm version
customer_reviews.author: easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sounding. Very musical speakers. I have them paired with 3050 fronts and 3070 center.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I've been longing for some time to try these speakers as they were rated highly by audio review sites. I haven't been disappointed. Though small, these speakers deliver a very clear and rich sound worth speakers many times of the price. Currently I do not have funky receiver or a CD player, but even with that, I am able to hear nuances of sound that frequently I haven't noticed. The QED cable that the company sent together with the speakers are excellent and improve sound by a lot than using no brand name wire. Overall, I recommend these and I am sure you can also be satisfied with other similar speakers from the Q Acoustics.
customer_reviews.author: Value seeker

customer_reviews.title: Q Acoustics hit it out of the park!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have quick crisp response and striking deep bass for their size. They are also solid and handsome. I use quality amp and preamp combo with smart phone/Pandora as source and 10 Guage cables. Very very nice!
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cosmetic damage
customer_reviews.text: These sound good but they arrived with what almost looked a water ring on top of both. The wood finish was inconsistent. Also on the right side of one there is a bubble in that band that encases the speakers. Additionally one of the rubber stoppers for the bottom broke when I was screwing it in. Q Acoustics customer service was good, they said just return for a full refund which I ended up not doing because I waited too long! Oops. Make sure you examine them well for cosmetic damage if you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Matthew Cutlip

customer_reviews.title: These are great bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are great bookshelf speakers. I've had them about a week and couldn't be more pleased. The 3020's present a clear and accurate sound that rivals my DefTec and Cambridge Audio bookshelf speakers. When paired with a small sub-woofer, they fill the room with great detail and range, regardless of the music type. Highly recommend if you are looking for speakers in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: Q Acoustics Builds A Small Bookshelf Speaker That No Klipsch Can Compare With
customer_reviews.text: You'll need at least a 50w per channel unit to really appreciate how good this inexpensive speaker sounds. Read the review Q Acoustics 3020 from What HiFi on line.
customer_reviews.author: MMH

customer_reviews.title: Caveat for the room size
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as advertised. However, these are small, so you should plan accordingly if the intent is to install them in a larger room. I had mine powered through a Marantz receiver and found them adequate but lacking in heft.
customer_reviews.author: Urmuz

product_meta.title: Q Acoustics 3020 Bookshelf Speaker Pair (Graphite)
feature_bullets: The medium sized 3020 bookshelf speakers benefit from the advanced, low distortion, wide dispersion Concentric Ring Dome tweeter; uprated crossover and improved low resonance cabinet

A large 5 inch drive unit with Aramid fiber/paper cone material, more commonly known as Kevlar, delivers an extended big bass response with fast dynamics a wonderfully open and realistic mid-range sound
The cabinet is made of 15mm MDF panels but with a double-layer 30mm top plate and similarly layered 24mm front baffle. This structure is then braced in specific places to control resonances

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars274 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
